Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 23rd overall pick, by Detroit in 1970...
Traded from Detroit to Minnesota on 2/13/1970 (Going to MIN: LF T. Poquette. Going to DET: LF G. Hiser)...
Injured on 8/12/1970 with a Strained Back, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 5/9/1972 with a Jammed Finger, out for one week...
Injured on 4/22/1973 with a Stiff Neck, out for 5 days...
Injured on 4/15/1975 with a Sprained Ankle, out for 3 days...
Injured on 8/9/1976 with a Inflamed Groin Muscle, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 4/3/1977, off Nelson Briles (CLE)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/14/1977, off Dick Wantz (CAL)...
Won World Series with Minnesota in 1977...
Won World Series with Minnesota in 1978...
Had 20-game hitting streak snapped on 5/29/1979...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/19/1981, hitting .458 with 4 HR, 10 RBI...
Was selected to the 1981 Allstar game...
Won World Series with Minnesota in 1982...
